page.title: 08Gosport Farm - a visit
page.content: {Gosport Farm}At Gosport Farm we were introduced to Mr. Pollard who gave us lots of information about his work, looking after the cows. He explained the methods of ear tagging and branding for identification. Milking is done by machine and 25-30 litres of milk is produced per cow. All the milk is taken by the Milk Marketing Board. The bull 'William' is valued at Â£1,000 and his calves sell at Â£200 each. As on most farms, grass acreage is used to produce silage for winter feeding. About 500 tonnes can be produced from 59 acres. Gosport Farm covers 280 acres which has to be cut during fine weather or it wont keep.The farmhouse, built in Queen Anne's time, was originally built as an inn in the 1700's and then converted to its present use at a later date.
